When device was connected to a lower assurance network/system based on FIPS 199 security categorization.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Media Protection">ed87f9fcdb211010280df36f299619af</control_family> <control_name>Nondestructive Techniques</control_name> <control_number>MP-06(03)</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory Enhancement</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>MP-06</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>false</moderate> <number>ARSC0011061</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:27</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>FIPS Pub: 199; NIST SP: 800-60, 800-88</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>SI-3</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>This control enhancement applies to digital media containing Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). Portable storage devices can be the source of malicious code insertions into organizational information systems. Many of these devices are obtained from unknown and potentially untrustworthy sources and may contain malicious code that can be readily transferred to information systems through USB ports or other entry portals. While scanning portable storage devices for malicious code is recommended, sanitization provides additional assurance that the devices are free of malicious code, including code capable of initiating zero-day attacks.
